The accreditation system for private detention centers is an utter sham. I wrote last week to private prisons, @DHSgov & the accreditors looking for answers, but one thing is already clear: we need real accountability to protect the lives of everyone detained at these facilities.

Happy #Pride, Boston! It’s my favorite day of the year because it’s the day we celebrate love. Don’t just march in #BostonPride today – DANCE. Be #wickedproud of who you are because our diversity makes our Commonwealth & our country stronger.

Happy birthday to one of my personal heroes, @GabbyGiffords. For years, she has selflessly fought for gun safety. Gabby’s bravery in the face of adversity inspires me to keep fighting for the ideals of our country.

From the opioid crisis to psilocybin’s potential w/ PTSD, it’s well past time we take drug use out of criminal consideration + into medical consideration.

That begins with research. I’m proud to introduce an amendment that helps scientists do their jobs. https://www.forbes.com/sites/tomangell/2019/06/08/aoc-pushes-to-make-it-easier-to-study-shrooms-and-other-psychedelic-drugs/

This obstruction has to stop —it's time for the Senate to pass these bills.

This is downright reprehensible and exactly why we must fight.

What we want is a justice system where no one is above the law, not even the president of the United States. #NAACP

Americans are already struggling to make ends meet with the rising cost of living. Meeting the basic human need of housing shouldn’t destroy them financially. I wrote about my plan to ensure all people have access to safe, affordable housing. 
https://www.rgj.com/story/opinion/voices/2019/06/06/cory-bookers-plan-ensure-safe-affordable-housing-everyone/1369964001/

The heroes of my youth were the lawyers of the civil rights movement — people like Thurgood Marshall, Charles Hamilton Houston, and Constance Baker Motley. They demonstrated how the law could be a tool for fairness and a weapon in the fight for justice.

As San Francisco's DA, I created Back on Track, a program designed to prevent recidivism among nonviolent, low-level drug defendants. The program provided job training and support and strengthened the community. More initiatives like these can reform our criminal justice system.

In the last 40 years, corporations have squeezed everything they can out of workers while giving massive compensation to those on top.
 
The result: half of Americans have virtually no wealth and live paycheck to paycheck.

We’re going to create an economy that works for all.
